title.narrative: OUTPUT 4: QUALITY OF CARE

description.narrative: By 2022, appropriate and workable quality of care models for maternal, newborn and child health will be scaled up in target districts., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most at-risk newborns and children are benefiting from integrated newborn, child health interventions and healthy behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, appropriate and workable quality of care models for maternal, newborn and child health will be scaled up in targetdistricts.

description.narrative: UNICEF technical assistance led to six quality of care frameworksfor maternal and newborn health which will be implemented in 2021.National RMNCAH quality of care strategicandaccountability frameworkwasfinalized in alignment with provincial frameworks, National RMNCAH vision and plans. About 3.1 million mothers and newborns benefited from homebased newborn care, 5,686 preterm infants received life-sustaining care at 33 Kangaroo Mother Care units and 3,350 sick newborns with limited access to higher-level health care facilities were treated for possible serious bacterial infections. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2021
